original_solution_mapping.L2: It will take him 16 hours because 160 / 10 = <<160/10=16>>16
original_solution_mapping.L3: His ice maker will cost $24 to run because 16 x 1.5 = <<16*1.5=24>>24
original_solution_mapping.L4: He will need 320 ounce of water because 160 x 2 = <<160*2=320>>320
original_solution_mapping.L5: This will cost him $32 because 320 x .1 = <<320*.1=32>>32

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6115.
    Returns: the total cost to make all the ice.
    """
    # L1
    pounds_needed = 10 # 10 pounds of cubes
    cube_weight_per_pound = Fraction(1, 16) # each cube weighs 1/16th of a pound
    total_cubes_needed = pounds_needed / cube_weight_per_pound

    # L2
    cubes_per_hour = 10 # 1 hour to make 10 cubes
    total_hours_needed = total_cubes_needed / cubes_per_hour

    # L3
    cost_per_hour_ice_maker = 1.50 # Every hour his ice maker run costs $1.50
    ice_maker_cost = total_hours_needed * cost_per_hour_ice_maker

    # L4
    ounces_per_cube = 2 # 2 ounces of water make 1 cube
    total_ounces_water_needed = total_cubes_needed * ounces_per_cube

    # L5
    cost_per_ounce_water = 0.10 # Every ounce of water costs $0.10
    water_cost = total_ounces_water_needed * cost_per_ounce_water

    # L6
    total_cost = ice_maker_cost + water_cost

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: It will take him {total_hours_needed} hours because {total_cubes_needed} / {cubes_per_hour} = <<{total_cubes_needed}/{cubes_per_hour}={total_hours_needed}>>{total_hours_needed}
His ice maker will cost ${ice_maker_cost} to run because {total_hours_needed} x {cost_per_hour_ice_maker} = <<{total_hours_needed}*{cost_per_hour_ice_maker}={ice_maker_cost}>>{ice_maker_cost}

He will need {total_ounces_water_needed} ounce of water because {total_cubes_needed} x {ounces_per_cube} = <<{total_cubes_needed}*{ounces_per_cube}={total_ounces_water_needed}>>{total_ounces_water_needed}
This will cost him ${water_cost} because {total_ounces_water_needed} x {cost_per_ounce_water} = <<{total_ounces_water_needed}*{cost_per_ounce_water}={water_cost}>>{water_cost}
It will cost in total ${total_cost} to make all the ice because {ice_maker_cost} + {water_cost} = <<{ice_maker_cost}+{water_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: This will cost him $32 because 320 x 0.1 = <<320*0.1=32>>32

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'cube_weight_per_pound' (1/16) was used instead of 'cubes_per_hour' (10).
